intro: Cynodon barberi f. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved carpetgrass, is a variant of the species Cynodon barberi, which belongs to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is native to southern Africa and is often found in regions with a warm, temperate climate. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural applications.
